Description: The Tribulations of St Antony; the saint is in mid-air, tormented by demons, an impression with double lines in some areas (principally the saint's face) due to shifting of the paper during the printing process; sheet torn and made up in various places, particularly the upper right corner; vertical crease. c.1469-73 Engraving
Curator's comments: Stogdon notes that impressions of the first state of this print are watermarked with paper used 1469-73 (see Hollstein Introduction).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (54.II)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.243.54.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Hans Sloane (with Philipe's oval stamp and the initials HS)
